result.execSummary:
The defendant Gordon Alexander Doleshal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gordon Alexander Doleshal

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.

Defendant Gordon Alexander Doleshal in court with attorney Jeffrey William Purnell.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties.    Court sentences defendant to serve 3 days  in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court ordered defendant to pay a forfeiture in the amount of $300.00 plus all costs and surcharges.    Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $100.00 per month with the first payment due on 02-01-2016 and additional payments due the 1st of each month thereafter.  If there are any missed payments any remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court.

filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Gordon Alexander Doleshal in court with attorney Jeffrey William Purnell.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
For reasons stated on the record, defense requests an adjourned plea/sentencing date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gordon Alexander Doleshal in court with attorney Jeffrey William Purnell.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
All previously ordered conditions as to bail to remain in effect.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Gordon Alexander Doleshal in court with attorney Jeffrey William Purnell.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Gordon Alexander Doleshal not in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. Court ordered that any bail be forfeited but held subject to restitution and recompense.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Gordon Alexander Doleshal in court.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Informed the court that he is hiring  Private Counsel.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 08-17-2015 at 01:30pm
